2306020.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306020
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 001
2306020.text: Abu Hurayra said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, would say in the morning, 'We have reached the morning and and all praise belongs to Allah who has no partner. There is no god but Allah and to Him is the gathering.' In the evening he would say, 'We have reached the evening and the kingdom belongs to Allah and all praise belongs to Allah who has no partner. There is no god but Allah and to Him is the return."

2306030.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306030
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 002
2306030.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The noble son of the noble son of the noble son of the noble son was Yusuf son of Ya'qub son of Ishaq son of Ibrahim, the Khalil (close friend) of the Merciful, the blessed and Exalted." The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "If I had remained in prison for as long as Yusuf remained in prison and then the man with the invitation had come to me, I would have accepted it. When the messenger came to him, he said, 'Go back to your master and enquire of him what happened about the women who cut their hands.' (12:50) Allah showed mercy to Lut when he sought refuge in a strong pillar when he said to his people, 'If only I had the strength to combat you or could seek refuge in a some powerful support!' (11:80) Allah did not send any Prophet after him but that he was one of the wealthy of his people."

2306040.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306040
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 003
2306040.text: 'Abdu'r-Rahman ibn Yazid said, "Ar-Rabi' used to go to 'Alqama every Friday. When I was not there, they would send for me. Once he came when I was not there. 'Alqama met me and told me, 'Did you not see what ar-Rabi' brought? He said, "Do you not see how frequently people make supplication and how rarely they are answered? That is because Allah Almighty only accepts the sincere supplication."' I asked, 'Didn't 'Abdullah say that?' He asked, 'What did he say?' I said that 'Abdullah said, 'Allah does not listen to someone who wants other people to hear not someone who shows off nor who plays. He only listens to the one who makes a supplication firmly from his heart.' He said, 'Did he mention 'Alqama?' 'Yes' was the answer."

2306050.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306050
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 004
2306050.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "When one of you makes a supplication, he should not say, 'If you wish.' He should be firm in asking and he should have great hope. Allah does not think that anything that He gives is too great.'"

2306060.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306060
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 005
2306060.text: Anas reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "When one of you makes a supplication, he should be firm in the supplication and not say, 'O Allah, if you like, give to me.' Allah cannot be forced against His will."

2306070.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306070
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 006
2306070.text: Abu Nu'aym, who is Wahb, said, "I saw Ibn 'Umar and Ibn az-Zubayr making supplication, cupping their palms in front of their faces."

2306080.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306080
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 007
2306080.text: 'A'isha say that she saw the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, making supplication with his hands raised, saying, 'I am a man, so do not punish me. If I harm any man of the believers or revile him, do not punish me for that.'"

2306090.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306090
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 008
2306090.text: Abu Hurayra said, "At-Tufayl ibn 'Amr ad-Dawsi came to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and said, 'Messenger of Allah, Daws have rebelled and rejected, so ask Allah to curse them.' The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, faced the qibla and raised his hands and the people thought that he was going to curse them. He said, 'O Allah, guide Daws and lead them.'"

2306100.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306100
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 009
2306100.text: Anas said, "No rain fell for a year and so one of the Muslims went to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, on Jumu'a (Friday). He said, 'Messenger of Allah, there has been no rain and the ground is dry and people's wealth has been destroyed.' He raised his hand when there was not a cloud to be seen in the sky. He stretched out his arms until I could see the whiteness of his armpits and asked Allah for rain. As soon as we finished the prayer, (the rain was such that) the youth whose house was near was afraid to return to his family. It last past Friday, The following Friday, they said, 'Messenger of Allah, the houses have fallen down and the paths are blocked.' He smiled and observed how quickly the son of Adam becomes discontented. He said while making a gesture with his hand, 'O Allah, around us and not on us.' And the rain cleared away from Madina."

2306110.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306110
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 010
2306110.text: 'Ikrima heard 'A'isha, may Allah be pleased with her, say that she saw the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, raise his hands in supplication, saying, 'O Allah, I am only a man, so do not punish me. If I harm or revile a Muslim man, do not punish me for it!'"

2306120.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306120
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 011
2306120.text: Jabir ibn 'Abdullah reported that at-Tufayl ibn 'Amr asked the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, "Do you want a fortress and a citadel? The fortress of Daws." The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, refused it because of what Allah had stored up for the Ansar. At-Tufayl made hijra and a man of his people made hijra with him. The man fell ill and was in torment (or words to that effect) and he crawled over to a quiver, took out an arrow, sliced his veins and died. At-Tufayl saw him a dream and asked him, "What has been done to you?" He replied, "I was forgiven because of my hijra to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace." He asked, "What happened to your hands?" He replied, "It was said, 'We will not put right in you that part of your hands which you destroyed.'" He said that at-Tufayl related that tot he Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and the Prophet said, "O Allah, forgive his hands!" and he raised his hands when he said it.

2306130.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306130
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 012
2306130.text: Anas ibn Malik said, "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to seek refuge with Allah, saying, 'O Allah, I seek refuge with you from laziness. I seek refuge with You from cowardice. I seek refuge with you from senility. I seek refuge with You from miserliness.'"

2306140.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306140
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 013
2306140.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said that Allah Almighty said, "I am according to My slave's opinion of Me, and I am with him when He calls on Me.'"

2306150.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306150
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 014
2306150.text: Shaddad ibn Aws reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The best way of asking forgiveness is 'O Allah, You are my Lord. There is no god but You. You created me and I am Your slave. I follow Your covenant and promise as much as I can. I acknowledge Your blessing and I confess to my wrong actions, so forgive me. Only You can forgive wrong actions. I seek refuge with You from the evil of what I have done.' If he says it in the evening and then dies, he will enter the Garden - or he said that he will be one of the people of the Garden. If he says it in the morning and dies that day - it is the same."

2306160.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306160
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 015
2306160.text: Ibn 'Umar said, "We used to say this a hundred times in the assembly of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, 'O Lord, forgive me and turn back to me (forgive me). You are the Ever-Turning back (to his slaves), the Merciful.'"

2306170.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306170
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 016
2306170.text: 'A'isha said, "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, prayed the Duha prayer and then said, 'O Lord, forgive me and turn to me. You are the Ever-Turning back (to his slaves), the Merciful' a hundred times."

2306180.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306180
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 017
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 017
2306180.text: Similar to hadith 617 but with a slightly different wording.

2306190.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306190
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 018
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 018
2306190.text: 'Abdullah ibn 'Umar said, "I heard the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, 'Turn in repentance to Allah. I turn to Him a hundred times every day."

2306200.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306200
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 019
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 019
2306200.text: 'Glory be to Allah'; 'Praise be to Allah'; and 'There is no god but Allah' a hundred times."

2306210.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306210
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 020
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 020
2306210.text: 'Abdullah ibn 'Amr reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The swiftest supplication to be answered is the supplication of someone for another person who is not present."

2306220.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306220
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 021
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 021
2306220.text: Abu Bakr as-Siddiq was heard to say, "The supplication of a brother in Allah is answered."

2306230.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306230
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 022
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 022
2306230.text: Safwan ibn 'Abdullah ibn Safwan, who was married to the daughter of Abu'd-Darda', said, "I visited them in Syria and found Umm ad-Darda' in the house, but not Abu'd-Darda'. She asked, 'Are you intending to go on hajj this year?' 'Yes,' I replied. She said, 'Make supplication to Allah and ask for good for us. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The supplication of a Muslim man for his absent brother is answered. At his head there is a guardian angel. Whenever he asks Allah to give his brother good, the angel says, 'Amen, and may you have the same.'"' I met Abu'd-Darda' in the market and he said something similar which was related from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace."

2306240.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306240
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 023
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 023
2306240.text: 'Abdullah ibn 'Amr reported that a man said, "O Allah, forgive me and Muhammad alone!" The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "You have veiled it from many people."

2306250.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306250
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 024
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 024
2306250.text: Ibn 'Umar said, "I heard the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, asking Allah to forgive him a hundred times in this assembly with the words, 'O Allah, forgive me and turn to me and show mercy to me. You are the Ever-Turning back (to his slaves), Merciful.'"

2306260.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306260
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 025
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 025
2306260.text: Ibn 'Umar said, "I make supplication in everything I do - even that Allah will make the stride of my animal long so that I find ease in that."

2306270.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306270
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 026
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 026
2306270.text: It is reported that 'Umar used to make supplication with his words, ") Allah, let me die with the pious and do not leave me among the evil. Join me to the good."

2306280.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306280
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 027
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 027
2306280.text: 'Our Lord, make peace between us and guide us on the path of Islam. Save us from the darkness (and bring us) to the light. Remove acts of deviance from us, both open and hidden. Bless us in our ears, our eyes, our hearts, our wives and our children. Turn to us. You are the Ever-Turning back (to his slaves), Most Merciful. Make us thankful for Your blessing and make us among those who give praise for it and proclaim it. Perfect it for us."

2306290.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306290
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 028
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 028
2306290.text: When Anas made supplication for his brother, he said, "May Allah bless him with the blessing of those who are pious. They are neither unjust nor corrupt. They stand at night in prayer and fast in the day."

2306300.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306300
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 029
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 029
2306300.text: 'Amr ibn al-Harith said, "My mother took me to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and stroked my head and prayed for provision to be given to me."

2306310.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306310
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 030
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 030
2306310.text: Anas ibn Malik was told, "Your brothers have come to you from Basra (and that day he was at the zawiyya) wanting for you to make supplication to Allah for them." He said, "O Allah, forgive them and show mercy to them. Give them good in this world and good in the Next World and protect them from the punishment of the Fire." They asked him to say more and he said repeated the same thing. He said, "If you are given this, you have been given the good of this world and the Next."

2306320.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306320
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 031
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 031
2306320.text: Anas ibn Malik said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, took a bough and shook it and not all the leaves fell off. Then he shook it again and not all the leaves fell off. Then he shook it a third time but not all the leaves fell off. He said, 'Saying, "Glory be to Allah and praise be to Allah and there is no god but Allah" makes errors fall away as the leaves of a tree fall away.'"

2306330.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306330
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 032
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 032
2306330.text: Anas reported that a woman came to the Prophet, to complain to him of a need. He said, 'Shall I show you something better than that? You should say, 'There is no god but Allah' 33 times when you go to sleep and say 'Glory be to Allah' 33 times and say 'Praise be to Allah' 34 times and then that hundred is better than his world and all that it contains.'"

2306340.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306340
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 033
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 033
2306340.text: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "If someone says, 'There is no god but Allah' one hundred times, 'Glory be to Allah' one hundred times' and 'Allah is greater' one hundred times, that is better than freeing ten slaves and slaughtering seven camels."

2306350.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306350
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 034
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 034
2306350.text: A man came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and said, "Messenger of Allah, what is the best supplication?" He answered, "Asking Allah for forgiveness and well-being in this world and the Next world." Then he came to him the following day and asked, "Prophet of Allah, what is the best supplication?" He answered, "Asking Allah for forgiveness and well-being in this world and the Next world. When you are given well-being in this world and the Next, then you have achieved success."

2306360.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306360
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 035
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 035
2306360.text: 'Glory be to Allah who has no partner. His is the Kingdom and praise is His and He has power over all things. There is no power nor strength except by Allah. Glory be to Allah and by His praise."

2306370.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306370
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 036
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 036
2306370.text: "O Allah, I ask You for all good, both sooner and later, what I know of it and what I do not know. I seek refuge with You from all evil, both sooner and later, what I know of it and what I do not know. I ask You for the Garden an d whatever words or actions bring one near to it. I seek refuge with You from the Fire and whatever words or actions bring one near to it. I ask You by what Muhammad asked You and I seek refuge from You by what Muhammad sought refuge from and whatever fate You have decreed for me, make its end right guidance."'"

2306380.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306380
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 037
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 037
2306380.text: Abu Sa'id al-Khudri reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "If any Muslim does not have anything to give as sadaqa, he should say in his supplication, 'O Allah, bless Muhammad, Your slave and Your Messenger and bless the believers, both men and women, and the Muslims, both men and women.' That will be sadaqa for him."

2306390.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306390
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 038
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 038
2306390.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "If anyone says, 'O Allah, bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad as You blessed Ibrahim and the family of Ibrahim. Shower blessings on Muhammad and the family of Muhammad as You showered blessings on Ibrahim and the family of Ibrahim. Show mercy to Muhammad and the family of Muhammad as You showed mercy to Ibrahim and the family of Ibrahim,' I will testify for him on the Day of Rising and I will intercede for him."

2306400.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306400
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 039
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 039
2306400.text: Malik ibn Aws ibn al-Hadathan said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, went out to open ground to answer a call of nature and did not find anyone to follow him. 'Umar went out and followed him with a clay pot or wudu' vessel. He found him prostrating in a river bed. He fell back and sat behind him until the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, lifted his head. He said, 'You have done well, 'Umar. When you found me prostrating, you went behind me. Jibril came to me and said, 'If someone says the prayer on you once, Allah will pray ten times on him and raise him ten degrees.'"

2306410.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306410
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 040
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 040
2306410.text: Anas ibn Malik reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "If anyone says the prayer on me once, Allah blesses him ten times and removes ten errors from him."

2306420.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306420
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 041
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 041
2306420.text: Jabir ibn 'Abdullah reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, went up the minbar. When he reached the first step, he said, "Amen". When he ascended to the second step, he said, "Amen," and when he stepped onto the third step, he said, "Amen." They said, "Messenger of Allah, we heard you say 'Amen' three times." He said, "When I went up the first step, Jibril, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, came to me and said, 'Wretched is the slave to whom Ramadan comes and when it passes from him is not forgiven.' I said, 'Amen.' Then he said, 'Wretched is the slave who has one or both of his parents alive and they do not let him enter the Garden.' I said, 'Amen.' Then he said, 'Wretched is a slave who does not bless you when you are mentioned in his presence,' and I said, 'Amen.'"

2306430.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306430
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 042
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 042
2306430.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "If anyone prays once on me, Allah will pray ten times on him.'"

2306440.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306440
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 043
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 043
2306440.text: Similar to 644 except it has "Shame on" rather than "Wretched is;"

2306450.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306450
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 044
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 044
2306450.text: 'Glory be to Allah and by His praise in number as great as His creation and in accordance with His own pleasure and the weight of His Throne and the extent of His words.'"

2306460.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306460
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 045
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 045
2306460.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Seek refuge with Allah from Hellfire. Seek refuge with Allah from the punishment of the grave. Seek refuge with Allah from the sedition of the Dajjal. Seek refuge with Allah from the trials of life and death."

2306470.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306470
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 046
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 046
2306470.text: Jabir reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "O Allah, let my hearing and sight be sound and make them remain sound until I die. Turn away from me the one who wrongs me and give me revenge on him."

2306480.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306480
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 047
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 047
2306480.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to say, "O Allah, let me enjoy my sight and hearing and make them remain sound until I die. Turn away my enemy and grant me revenge on him."

2306490.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306490
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 048
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 048
2306490.text: Tariq ibn Ashyam al-Ashja'i said, "We used to go and visit the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. On one occasion a man and woman came and the man asked, 'Messenger of Allah, what should I say when I pray?' He replied, 'Say, "O Allah, forgive me, show mercy to me, guide me and provide for me.; They will combine this world and the Next world for you.'"

2306500.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306500
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 049
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 049
2306500.text: Umm Qays reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to her, "What she said will make her life long. They said, "We do not know of any woman who was given the long life that she was given."

2306510.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306510
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 050
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 050
2306510.text: Anas said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to come to us, the people of his house. One day he came to us and made supplication for us. Umm Sulaym said, 'Won't you make supplication for your little servant?' He said, 'O Allah, give him a lot of wealth and children. Make him live long and forgive him.'

2306520.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306520
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 051
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 051
2306520.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The supplication of any of you is answered as long as he does not get impatient and say, 'I made supplication and was not answered.'"

2306530.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306530
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 052
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 052
2306530.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The supplication of any of you is answered as long as he does not make supplication for something which is a wrong action or cutting off ties of kinship or become impatient and say, 'I made supplication and was not answered,' and so he stops making supplication.'"

2306540.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306540
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 053
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 053
2306540.text: 'Amr ibn Shu'ayb reported that his grandfather said, "I heard the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, 'O Allah, I seek refuge with You from laziness and debt. I seek refuge with You from the trial of the Dajjal. I seek refuge with You from the punishment of the Fire.'"

2306550.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306550
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 054
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 054
2306550.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to seek refuge with Allah from the evils of life and death and the punishment of the grave and the evil of the Dajjal."

2306560.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306560
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 055
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 055
2306560.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Allah is angry with someone who does not ask of Him."

2306570.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306570
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 056
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 056
2306570.text: Anas reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "When you call on Allah, be definite in your supplication. None of you should say, 'If You will, give it to me.' No one can force Allah."

2306580.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306580
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 057
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 057
2306580.text: 'Uthman said that he heard the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "A person will not be harmed by anything if he says every morning and evening 33 times, 'In the Name of Allah by whose Name nothing in the earth or the heaven is harmed. He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.'"

2306590.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306590
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 058
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 058
2306590.text: when the call to prayer has been given and when in battle ranks in the Cause of Allah."

2306600.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306600
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 059
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 059
2306600.text: Abu Sirma reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to say, "O Allah, I ask You to make me wealthy and make my mawla wealthy!"

2306610.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306610
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 060
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 060
2306610.text: 'O Allah, protect me from the evil of my sight and hearing, my tongue, my heart, and the evil of my desire.'"

2306620.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306620
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 061
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 061
2306620.text: 'Abdullah ibn 'Abbas reported that the Messenger of Allah may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to say, "O Allah, help me and do not help against me. Support me and do not support anyone against me. Make guidance easy for me."

2306630.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306630
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 062
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 062
2306630.text: 'O Allah, help me and do not help anyone against me. Devise for me and do not devise against me. Make guidance easy for me. Avert from me the one who attacks me. O Lord, make me grateful to You, remember You, fearful of You, obedient to You and humble to You, supplicating, penitent. Accept my repentance. Wash away my wrong actions and answer my supplication. Establish my proof and guide my heart. Make my tongue correct and make resentment flow out of my heart.'"

2306640.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306640
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 063
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 063
2306640.text: Mu'awiya ibn Abi Sufyan said on the minbar, "None can withhold what You give nor give what Allah withholds. The effort of a person who makes an effort does not benefit him. When Allah desires good for a person, He gives him understanding in the deen." He added, "I heard these words from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace."

2306650.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306650
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 064
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 064
2306650.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The firmest supplication is to say, 'O Allah, you are my Lord and I am Your slave. I have wronged myself and I admit my wrong action. Only You forgive wrong actions, Lord, forgive me.'"

2306660.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306660
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 065
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 065
2306660.text: 'O Allah, make my deen correct - it is the support of my affairs. Make my deen correct - it contains my livelihood. Make death a mercy for me from every evil.'"

2306670.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306670
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 066
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 066
2306670.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to seek refuge "from the trouble of affliction, meeting with wretchedness, an evil decree, and the gloating of enemies."

2306680.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306680
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 067
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 067
2306680.text: laziness, miserliness, bad pride, the trial of what is in the breast, and the punishment of the grave."

2306690.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306690
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 068
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 068
2306690.text: Anas ibn Malik said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to say, 'O Allah, I seek refuge with You from incapacity, laziness, cowardice and old age. I seek refuge with You from the trials of life and death. I seek refuge with You from the punishment of the grave.'"

2306700.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306700
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 069
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 069
2306700.text: Anas said, "I heard the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, 'O Allah, I seek refuge with You from concern, sorrow, incapacity, laziness, cowardice, miserliness, being deeply in debt and being overpowered by men.'"

2306710.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306710
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 070
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 070
2306710.text: Abu Hurayra said, "One of the supplications of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was 'O Allah, forgive me for my past and future wrong actions, what I conceal and what I divulge, and what You know of me. You are the One who puts ahead and delays. There is no god but You."

2306720.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306720
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 071
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 071
2306720.text:
'Abdullah said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to make this supplication, 'O Allah, I ask You for guidance, abstention and wealth.'"

And it has been narrated "and heedfulness."

2306730.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306730
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 072
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 072
2306730.text: Thumana ibn Huzn said, "I heard a shaykh call out in a loud voice, 'O Allah, I seek refuge with You from unadulterated evil.' I asked, 'Who is this shaykh?' I was told, 'Abu'd-Darda'.'"

2306740.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306740
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 073
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 073
2306740.text: 'Abdullah ibn Abi 'Awfa reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to say, "O Allah, purify me with ice, snow and cold water as the dirty garment is cleansed of dirt. O Allah, our Lord, praise is Yours in quantity as great as the sky and as great as the earth and as great as You wish from anything beyond that."

2306750.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306750
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 074
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 074
2306750.text: Anas reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to make supplication with this supplication, "O Allah, give us good in this world and good in the Next World and protect us from the punishment of the Fire."

2306760.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306760
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 075
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 075
2306760.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to say, "O Allah, I seek refuge with You from poverty, need and abasement. I seek refuge with You from being unjust or wronged."

2306770.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306770
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 076
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 076
2306770.text: "O Allah, We ask You for what Your Prophet Muhammad asked You, and we seek refuge with You from what Your Prophet Muhammad sought refuge. O Allah, You are the One to whom one turns for help and You are the One who brings it about. There is no power nor strength except by Allah," or words to that effect.'"

2306780.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306780
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 077
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 077
2306780.text: 'Amr ibn Shu'ayb reported from his father that his grandfather said, "I heard the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, 'O Allah, I seek refuge with You from the trial of the Dajjal and I seek refuge with You from the trial of the Fire.'"

2306790.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306790
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 078
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 078
2306790.text: Ibn 'Abbas used to say, "O Allah, make me content with the provision You have given me and bless me in it and appoint good for me in every thing which I do not have."

2306800.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306800
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 079
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 079
2306800.text: Anas said, "The most frequent supplication of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was, 'O Allah, give us good in this world and good in the Next World and protect us from the punishment of the Fire.'"

2306810.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306810
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 080
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 080
2306810.text: Anas said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, most frequently said, "O Allah, O Overturner of hearts, make my heart firm in Your deen."

2306820.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306820
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 081
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 081
2306820.text: 'O Allah, praise is Yours in quantity as great as the heavens and in quantity as great as the earth and in quantity as great as You wish from anything else. O Allah, purify me with ice, snow and cold water. O Allah, purify me from wrong actions and clean me as the white garment is cleansed of dirt.'"

2306830.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306830
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 082
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 082
2306830.text: 'Abdullah ibn 'Umar said, "One of the supplications of the Messenger of Allah was, 'O Allah, I seek refuge with You from the disappearance of Your blessing and from the loss of good health and Your sudden vengeance and all of Your anger.'"

2306840.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306840
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 083
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 083
2306840.text: 'A'isha said, "When the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, saw a cloud rising from the horizon, he would leave what he was doing, even if it was the prayer, and face towards it. If Allah dispersed it, he praised Allah, and if it rained, he said, 'O Allah, make it a useful fall!'"

2306850.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306850
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 084
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 084
2306850.text: Isma'il ibn Qays said, "I came to Khabbab when he had been cauterised seven times. He said, 'If it had not been that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, had forbidden us to pray for death, I would have done so.'"

2306860.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306860
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 085
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 085
2306860.text: Abu Musa reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to make this supplication, "O Allah, forgive my errors, my ignorance and my excess in all my affairs, and what You know better than me of these things. O Allah, forgive all my errors, what I do intentionally or out of my ignorance or in jest and in all that I do. O Allah, forgive me my past and future wrong actions, what I conceal of them and what I divulge. You are the One who puts things ahead and the One who delays them. You have power over all things."

2306870.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306870
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 086
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 086
2306870.text: Abu Musa al-Ash'ari used to use this supplication, "O Allah, forgive my errors, my ignorance and my extravagance in my affairs and what You know better than I do. O Allah, forgive me what I do both in jest and seriousness, my errors and what I do intentionally and all that I do."

2306880.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306880
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 087
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 087
2306880.text: "O Allah, help me to remember You and thank You and help me to the best manner of worshipping You."'"

2306890.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306890
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 088
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 088
2306890.text: Abu Ayyub al-Ansari said, "A man said in the presence of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, 'Praise belongs to Allah with blessed and abundant praise.; The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, 'Who said that?' The man was silent, thinking that it was a reprimand from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, for something he disliked. He asked again, 'Who was it? He said nothing incorrect.' The man said, 'I did, and I hope for good by it.' He said, 'By the One in whose hand my soul is, I saw thirteen angels racing one another to see which of them would take it to Allah Almighty.'"

2306900.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306900
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 089
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 089
2306900.text: Anas said, "When the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, wanted to enter the lavatory, he said, 'O Allah, I seek refuge with You from foulness and foul things.'"

2306910.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306910
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 090
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 090
2306910.text: 'A'isha said, "When the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, left the lavatory, he said, 'Your forgiveness!'"

2306920.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306920
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 091
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 091
2306920.text: 'I seek refuge with You from the punishment of Hellfire, and I seek refuge with You from the punishment of the grave. I seek refuge with You from the trial of the Dajjal and the I seek refuge from the trials of life and death. I seek refuge with You from the trial of the grave.'"

2306930.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306930
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 092
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 092
2306930.text: Ibn 'Abbas said, "I spent the night at the house of my aunt. Maymuna. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, got up to answer a call of nature and then washed his hands and face and slept. Then he got up and took the water-skin and loosened its strap and then did a medium sort of wudu' and no more but he did it adequately. Then he prayed. I stood up and went slowly, not wanting him to see that I was observing him. I did wudu'. Then he stood up to pray and I stood at his left. He took my hand and brought me around to his right. His complete night prayer consisted of twelve rak'ats. Then he lay down and went to sleep until he snored. When he slept, he would snore. Bilal gave the adhan for the morning prayer and he prayed without doing wudu'. One of his supplications was, 'O Allah, put light in my heart and light in my hearing and light on my right and light on my left and a light above me and a light behind me and a light in front of me and a light behind him and make my light great.'"

2306940.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306940
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 093
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 093
2306940.text: 'Abdullah ibn 'Abbas said, "When the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, prayed the night prayer, and finished his prayer, glorifying Allah as he deserves, he said at the end of it, 'O Allah, give me a light in my heart and give me a light in my hearing and give me a light in my sight. Give me a light on my right and a light on my left and give me a light in front of me and a light behind me and increase me in light. Increase me in light, and increase me in light.'"

2306950.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306950
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 094
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 094
2306950.text: 'Abdullah ibn 'Abbas said "When the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, rose to pray in the middle of the night, he would say, 'O Allah, Yours is the praise. You are the light of the heavens and the earth and whoever is in them. Yours is the praise. You are the Lord of the heavens and the earth and whoever is in them. You are the Truth and Your promise is true and the meeting with You is true. The Garden is true and the Fire is true and the Hour is true. O Allah, I have surrendered to You and I have believed in You. I have trusted in You and I repent to You. I argue by You and I have come to You for judgement. Forgive me my past and future wrong actions, what I conceal and what I show. You are My God. There is no god but You."

2306960.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306960
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 095
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 095
2306960.text: 'O Allah, I ask You for pardon and good health in this world and the Next. O Allah, I ask You for good health in my deen and my family. Veil my faults and assuage my terror. Guard me before me, behind me, on my right and my left and above me. I seek refuge with You from unexpected destruction from beneath me.'"

2306970.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306970
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 096
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 096
2306970.text: Rifa'a az-Zurqi said, "In the Battle of Uhud when the idolaters retreated, the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, 'Form straight ranks so that I can praise my Almighty Lord.' They formed in ranks behind him. He said, 'O Allah, all praise is due to You. O Allah, none can contract what You expand nor bring near what you put far away. None can put far away what You bring near. None can give what You withhold nor withhold what You give. O Allah, expand to us some of Your blessings, mercy and favour and give us provision! O Allah, I ask You for the abiding blessing which is neither changed nor removed. O Allah, I ask You for blessing on the Day of Utter Poverty and security on the Day of Fear. O Allah, I seek refuge with You from the evil of what You give us. O Allah, make us love belief and adorn our hearts with it. Make us hate disbelief, deviance and rebellion. Place us among the rightly-guided. O Allah, make us die Muslims and make us live as Muslims and join us to the rightly, acting, who are neither disappointed nor afflicted. O Allah, fight the unbelievers who bar your path and who deny Your Messengers. Place You abasement and punishment over them. O Allah, fight the unbelievers who were given the Book, O Lord of Truth!'"

2306980.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306980
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 097
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 097
2306980.text: 'There is no god but Allah, the Immense, the Forbearing. There is no god but Prophet, the Lord of the heavens and the earth and the Lord of the Immense Throne.'"

2306990.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2306990
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 098
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 098
2306990.text: 'O Allah, make me healthy in my body. O Allah, make me healthy in my hearing. O Allah, make me healthy in my sight. There is no god but You.' You repeat it three times in the evening and three times in the morning. And you say, 'O Allah, I seek refuge with You from disbelief and poverty. O Allah, I seek refuge with You from the punishment of the grave. There is no god but You,' and you repeat it three times in the evening and three times in the morning." He replied, :Yes, my son. I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say them and I like to follow his sunnah."

2307000.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307000
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 099
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 099
2307000.text: 'There is no god but Allah, the Immense, the Forbearing. There is no god but Allah, Lord of the Immense Throne, there is no god but Allah, the Lord of the heavens and the earth and the Lord of the Immense Throne.' O Allah, avert its evil."

2307010.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307010
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 100
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 100
2307010.text: Jabir said, "The Prophet. may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to teach us the istikhara in matters just as if it was a sura of the Qur'an. He said, 'When someone is concerned about something, he should pray two rak'ats and then say, 'O Allah, I ask You for the good by Your knowledge and I ask You for strength by Your power and I ask You for some of Your immense abundant favour, You have the power and I do not. You know and I do not know. You are the Knower of the Unseen Worlds. O Allah, if You know that this affair is good for me in my deen, my livelihood and the end of my affair (or he said 'in the beginning of my affair') and its conclusion, then avert it from me and avert me from it. Decree for me the good wherever it is and then make me content." Then he should state what he needs.'"

2307020.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307020
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 101
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 101
2307020.text: Jabir ibn 'Abdullah said, "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, made supplication in this mosque, the Mosque of Victory, on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday, and it was answered for him between the two prayers on Wednesday," Jabir said, "Whenever anything severe and serious happened to me and I singled out that time and made supplication to Allah concerning it between the two prayers on Wednesday, I found the answer.'"

2307030.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307030
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 102
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 102
2307030.text: Anas said, "I was with the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, when a man made supplication, saying, 'O Originator of the heavens! O Living, Self-Subsistent! I ask of You.' He said, 'Do you know by what he has made supplication? By the One in whose hand my soul is, he has asked Allah by the Name that He answers when He is asked by it."

2307040.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307040
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 103
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 103
2307040.text: 'Abdullah ibn 'Amr was heard to say, "Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with him, said to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, 'Teach me a supplication which I can use in my prayer.' He said, 'Say, "O Allah, I have wronged myself greatly. Only You forgive wrong actions. Forgive me with forgiveness directly from you. You are the Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful."'"

2307050.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307050
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 104
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 104
2307050.text: 'Abdullah ibn Mas'ud said, "When there is a ruler in charge of you whose arrogance or injustice is feared, you should say, 'O Allah, Lord of the Seven Heavens and Lord of the Immense Throne, be my Protector against so-and-so, the son of so-and-so, and his followers among Your creatures so that none of them exceeds the bounds towards me or oppresses me. Your protection is mighty and Your praise is great. There is no god but You.'"

2307060.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307060
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 105
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 105
2307060.text: Ibn 'Abbas said, "When you go to an awesome ruler and fear that he will attack you, say, 'Allah is greater. Allah is mightier than all His creation and Allah is greater than all that is feared and all that you are wary of. I seek refuge with Allah. There is no god but Him, the One who keeps the seven heavens from falling onto the earth by nothing except His permission, from the evil of your slave so-and-so and his armies and followers and supporters, both among jinn and men. O Allah, be my protector against their evil. Your praise is great and Your protection is immense, Blessed is Your Name. There is no god but You' three times."

2307070.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307070
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 106
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 106
2307070.text: 'I ask You by (the words) "There is no god but You, the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the Immense Throne" and I ask You by (the words) "There is no god but You, the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the Immense Throne" and I ask You by (the words) "There is no god but You, the Lord of the seven heavens and the seven earths and what is in them. You have power over all things.'" Then he should ask for what he needs."

2307080.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307080
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 107
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 107
2307080.text: either his supplication is answered quickly, or it is stored up for him in the Next World, or an evil equal to it is averted from him." It was said, "Then many supplications will be made." He replied, "Allah has more still to give."

2307090.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307090
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 108
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 108
2307090.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "No believer turns his face to Allah and asks Him for something but that He gives it to him, either by giving it to him sooner in this world or storing it up for him in the Next World, as long as he does not try to make it come quickly." They asked, "Messenger of Allah, what does 'making it come quickly' mean?" He said, "He says, 'I asked and asked and do not think that I will be answered.'"

2307100.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307100
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 109
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 109
2307100.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Nothing is dearer to Allah than supplication."

2307110.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307110
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 110
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 110
2307110.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The noblest act of worship is supplication."

2307120.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307120
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 111
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 111
2307120.text: An-Nu'man ibn Bashir reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Supplication is worship.' Then he recited, 'Call on Me and I will answer you.'"

2307130.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307130
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 112
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 112
2307130.text: 'A'isha said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was asked, 'Which type of worship is best?' He replied, 'A man's supplication for himself.'"

2307140.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307140
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 113
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 113
2307140.text: Maqil bin Yasar (ra) said that he came to the Prophet () with Abu Bakr (ra). He said, "O Abu Bakr, polytheism enters your people more quietly (secretly) than the movement of ants." Abu Bakr asked, "Is there a kind of polytheism besides associating anything with Allah?" The Prophet () said," By him who has my life in his power, polytheism is more concealed than the movement of ants. Shall I not teach you something which if you say will eliminate minor or major (polytheism)?" He then said, "Say `O Allah! I seek refuge in you lest I associate anything with you while I know it, and I seek your forgiveness for what I do not know."

2307150.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307150
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 114
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 114
2307150.text: "O Allah, I ask you from the good with which it is sent and I seek your protection from the evil with which it is sent".

2307160.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307160
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 115
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 115
2307160.text: " O Allah cause this wind to bring rain and let it not be without benefit".

2307170.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307170
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 116
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 116
2307170.text: (O Allah! We ask you the good of this wind and the good of what is therein and the good with which it is sent.)

2307180.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307180
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 117
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 117
2307180.text: It is stated by sayidina Abu Hurayrah (ra) that the Messenger of Allah () said "Wind is the mercy of Allah. It brings mercy or punishment. Do not denounce it but ask Allah, the exalted, for the good of it and seek the protection of Allah from its evil.

2307190.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307190
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 118
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 118
2307190.text: O Allah, slay us not with your lightening and destroy us not with your punishment. But, preserve us before that.

2307200.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307200
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 119
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 119
2307200.text: Glory be to him whom you glorified. He said that the thunderclap is an angel who yells at the rainclouds as a shepherd yells at his sheep/goats.

2307210.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307210
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 120
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 120
2307210.text: Glory be to him whose praise the thunderclap sings and the angels glorify in awe of him. He used to say, then, that the thunder-clap is a stern warning for the dwellers of earth.

2307220.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307220
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 121
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 121
2307220.text: Awsat bin Ismail has narrated that he heard Abu Bakr (ra) say after the death of the Prophet () This is the very place where the Prophet (), had stood in the first year of Hijrah. Saying that, he began to weep and added, "Hold on to truth because that is piety and both these things will carry a man to paradise. And, keep away from falsehood because it is a very grave sin and both of them will carry one to hell. And ask Allah for security because nothing greater than it is given to anyone apart from belief, and do not sever ties among yourselves. Do not turn your backs to one another nor be jealous of one another. And do not harbor mutual hatred. And, live as slaves of Allah, brothers of one another."

2307230.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307230
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 122
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 122
2307230.text: O Allah, I ask you for all of the blessing. He asked the man whether he knew what all the blessing meant and he said that it meant admittance to paradise and safety from Hell. Then the Prophet () passed by another man who was saying: O Allah! I ask you for patience. The Prophet () said to him, "You have asked your lord for trial and difficulty over yourself. So, now ask him also for safety (aafiyah)". The Prophet () then came across a third man who said: O owner of majesty and splendor!. The Prophet () said to him, "Make a request!" (because you have called Allah by this great attribute).

2307240.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307240
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 123
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 123
2307240.text: Abbas bin Abdul Mmuttalib (ra) said that he requested the Messenger of Allah () to teach him a supplication whereby he May request Allah for his needs. The Prophet () said,"0 Abbas, ask Allah for aafiyah (security). After some days, he again met the Prophet () and asked," Teach me a supplication to beseech Allah for my want." He said, "O Abbas! O uncle of the messenger of Allah! Ask Allah for aafiyah (security) in this world and the next."

2307250.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307250
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 124
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 124
2307250.text: (O Allah, let us have the good of this world and the good of the hereafter and save us from the torment of the fire).

2307260.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307260
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 125
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 125
2307260.text: O Allah, grant us what is good in this world and what is good in the hereafter, and save us from the chastisement of the fire." Then the Prophet () made a supplication for him and Allah, the Mighty, the Gracious, gave him cure from sickness.

2307270.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307270
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 126
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 126
2307270.text: (O Allah, I seek refuge in you from the distress of trial and then stops. When he makes this supplication he should also say (except a trial that produces elevation of ranks)

2307280.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307280
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 127
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 127
2307280.text: Abu Hurayrah (ra) has narrated that the Prophet () sought refuge in Allah from the distress of trial, being overtaken by a tribulation, malicious rejoicing of enemies, and perversity of fate.

2307290.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307290
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 128
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 128
2307290.text: Abu Naufal bin Abu Aqrab has narrated on the authority of his father that he asked the Prophet () about (voluntary) fasts. He said,"observe one fast every month." He submitted, "May my father and mother be ransomed to you, permit me to keep more. "The Prophet () repeated (in anger) what he had said, "permit me to keep more, permit me to keep more. He then added," keep two fasts every month". But, Abu Nawafals father again requested, "May my parents be ransomed to you, allow me to keep more because I find myself able (to observe more), I find myself able, I find myself able." He then maintained silence and it seemed that he would not give permission any more until he said," keep three fasts every month."

2307300.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307300
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 129
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 129
2307300.text: Jabir bin Abdullah (ra) said that they were with the Prophet ()when a very stinking gush of wind blew over there. The Prophet () they asked his companions (ra) if they knew what that was. He added, "It is the (stinking) air of those people who backbite the believers."

2307310.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307310
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 130
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 130
2307310.text: Jabir (ra) said that (once) a bad smelling wind blew in the times of the prophet Ig. The Messenger of Allah () said," The hypocrites are backbiting the Muslims. That is why this wind blows"

2307320.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307320
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 131
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 131
2307320.text: It is reported by Qasim bin Abdur Rahman as-Shami that he heard Ibn Unm Abd say, "If a believer is backbitten before someone and he helps the believer (by refuting backbiting) then Allah will reward him well in this world and the next. And, if a believer is backbitten before someone and he does not help him (by not refuting the backbiting) then Allah will give him a bad return for that in this world and the next. Further, if anyone does not take a morsel more than backbiting in his mouth and says that which he knows about him then he has backbitten him but if he says what he does not know about him then he has slandered him.

2307330.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307330
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 132
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 132
2307330.text: It is reported by Jabir bin Abdullah (ra) that they had accompanied the messenger of Allah when they came to two graves. Both the inmate of the graves were being punished. He said," They are being punished not for committing a grave sin. But, yes! (They are grave sins though on the face of it they are ordinary and it is easy to avoid them but their punishment is severe.) One of them was given to backbite other people while the other was not. Careful to clean himself of urine drops (over his body)". He then asked for one or two branches of fresh date palm and split them and dug them on each grave. He said afterwards," Soon their punishment will be softened as long as the branches are green." Or he said, Until they dry up.

2307340.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307340
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 133
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 133
2307340.text: It is reported by Qays that Amr bin al-Aas (ra) was going somewhere with his friends. They saw a dead mule whose belly had swollen up. Amr (ra)said," By Allah, it is better for one to eat to his full from this (dead mule) than to eat the flesh of a Muslim" (He meant to say that to backbite anyone is worse than eating the meat of a dead animal).

2307350.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307350
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 134
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 134
2307350.text: It is reported by Abu Hurayrah (ra) that Maiz bin Maalik al-Aslami (ra) came to the Prophet () repeatedly (so that he may be given the prescribed punishment for the sin he had committed). When he came the fourth time, the Prophet () gave orders for Rajam and he was stoned to death. The Messenger of Allah () and a few of his companions afterwards passed by him. One of the companions remarked," How many times this perished man came to the Prophet, and each time he turned him away until he was stoned like a dog." The Prophet () did not say anything and walked ahead till they came to the corpse of a donkey with its legs in the air. He said,"Eat some of this (corpse)." They asked "Messenger of Allah, from this dead donkey?" He said to them." That you have just backbited your brother is more serious than eating some of it (the donkey's corpse). By him in whose hand the soul of Muhammad is, he (Mariz bin Maalik) is now among the rivers of paradise plunging into it".

2307360.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2307360
In-book reference  : Book 31, Hadith 135
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 31, Hadith 135
2307360.text: Ubadah bin Walid said that he came out with his father Ubadah bin al-Samit and he was a young man at that time. They met an elderly Shaikh who had a mantle over him and Maafi garments. His slave too had a mantle and Maafai. The narrator (Ubadah bin Walid) said," My uncle! In this way, you would have had a pair of good quality garments and he would have had one striped mantle". The man turned to Ubadah bin al-Samit and asked," Is he your son?" He said," yes" Ubadah bin Walid said that the Shaikh stroked his head and said," May Allah bless you! I bear testimony that I heard the Messenger of Allah () say that we must feed the slaves the same thing that we eat and clothe them that which we wear. O son of my brother! It is more dear to me that I lose the possessions of this world than I lose anything of the hereafter". Ubadah bin Walid asked his father who the Shaikh was and he said." He is Abu al-Yasr Kab bin Amr"
